instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00164 PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
Clean board, already replaced Q7180 (2 times), U7000, D7005, Q7010, D7012, C7125

R7005, R7006, R7152, R7151, SMBUS_SDL and SCL are all fine.

Testing with original 45W and fake 85W same thing.

threads.title: 820-00164 PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message: Remove F7140 and check C7140 voltage.

threads.title: 820-00164 PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
3V42_G3H Present

U7100 basic voltages with original 45W adapter and F7140 installed:
1 0
2 15
3 3.9
9 0
12 3.4
13 3.3
14 3.3
15 0
17 3.2
18 3.2
19 3.2
20 5
27 15

threads.title: 820-00164 PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
"19 3.2"
I doubt; check it again.

Is C7125 good; replace it, just in case.
Be sure all traces and solders are good in the area.

You can also try replacing Q7130.

R7100 is OK?
Post exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 & 27/28.

threads.title: 820-00164 PPBUS 3.2V
threads.message:
U7100 basic voltages with original 45W adapter and F7140 installed:
1 0
2 15
3 3.9
9 0
12 3.4
13 3.3
14 3.3
15 0
17 3.2
18 3.2
19 5
20 5
27 15

C7125 was replaced and before or after same result.

Q7130 was it, thanks a lot!
